page.title: 18MR. GREENLEAVES (2)
page.content: At 11 years of age Mr.Greenleaves went to school in Runcorn having passed the 11+, travelling to school during the Great War by train with a contract ticket. No school uniform but a cap had to be worn. There were school dinners or sandwiches could be taken. About 25 pupils per class. In 1918 he secured a job in a bank staying for 44 years. He had a job whilst at primary school _collecting a gentleman's personal post bag from the Post Office and also delivering newspapers. Each evening after school he would collect the outgoing post in the bag and take it to the post office. There was little time for playing. Other boys would collect milk and deliver it usng a pint or quart jug to transfer milk from churn to jug.
